info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued March 26 at 3:34AM PDT until March 28 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS San Francisco CA
info.description:
* WHAT...For the first Beach Hazards Statement, a moderate period northwesterly swell will result in an increased risk for sneaker waves and rip currents. For the second Beach Hazards Statement, long period high northwesterly swell will result in breaking waves between 15 to 20 feet along favored break points.
* WHERE...Northern Monterey Bay.
* WHEN...For the first Beach Hazards Statement, until 11 AM PDT this morning. For the second Beach Hazards Statement, from late tonight through Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...Sneaker waves can unexpectedly run significantly farther up the beach than normal, including over rocks and jetties. These waves can suddenly knock people off their feet and quickly pull them into the cold ocean waters, where currents will be stronger than normal. These waves can also carry driftwood logs and other debris.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.

parameter.value: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING
